Peoria, Illinois

ers College, Terre Haute

mittee, Washington

casting System, Chicago
Charles A. Siepmann, Harvard University, Cambridge
Elmer G. Sulzer, Director, Radio Activities, University of Kentucky, Lex¬
ington
John W. Tinnea, Program Director, Station KWK, St. Louis
6. Radio in Religious Education, Room 1663
Frank Nelson, Minister, Community Presbyterian Church, Lakewood, Ohio,
Chairman
7. Clinic: Music Appreciation Broadcasts, Room 1279
Alton O’Steen, Research Associate, Evaluation of School Broadcasts, Ohio
State University, Chairman
Transcriptions of several different types of music appreciation broadcasts for
different age levels will be played in whole or in part. Discussion of the
techniques and materials of the broadcast will follow the playing of each
transcription. Representatives of university stations, public school broad¬
casting units, networks and commercial stations, whose music programs
will be played, will be present to explain their recordings and to enter into
the discussion of other recordings.
Transcriptions for Session I (Monday)
Music for Fun, Columbia Broadcasting System
Music for Young Listeners, Cleveland Public Schools
Music Enjoyment for Young Children, University of Wisconsin
Music for Young Listeners, Toledo Museum of Art
Standard School Broadcast, Pacific Coast Network, National Broadcasting
Company
• 7 *
